column1: Very special to be at the 20th Special Forces Group reunion today in Mobile. My brother Dale served in this group and it was great to catch up with many old friends.   My favorite quote of the day was:   “Bradley in this room you are Dale’s little brother.” https://t.co/RneSefxvDg

Starting out this morning in the heart of Tuscaloosa having breakfast with community leaders. We have a packed day on the campaign trail ahead of us. Follow along! #ALSen https://t.co/BVKZwgv6fI

Q: Do you support term limits?   “This seat we’re running for doesn’t belong to any one person. It belongs to the people of Alabama. Term limits ensure that the people going up there don’t ever become comfortable in the halls of Congress. I’ll continue to fight for term limits.”

Q: What can we do better to protect & support law enforcement?  Too many people in our society don’t respect them. When I think about them disrespecting our officers like my brother Dale & the brave law enforcement who put our safety above their own that burns me up. #ALSen

Q: How do you feel about amnesty?   “I appose amnesty. When someone comes across our border illegally they have broken our laws. If we’re going to be a nation of laws — we better enforce them.” #ALSen

Q: What’s an area you believe should be reserved for states?  “The federal gov needs to get out of education. We do NOT need a U.S. Department of Education. I trust our local school boards far more to know what our students should be learning than those people up in Washington.”

Q: How do you feel about red flag laws?   I don’t support them because they violate our due process rights under the Constitution. This issue comes down to a morality conflict of good vs. evil. We don’t need new law!
Great to be in Northport tonight participating in the @BamaCarry US Senate candidate forum. Our team will be live posting questions and responses. #ALSen https://t.co/KVrrirxrt6
